thread.title: Clyde duo fall in first round at state tennis meet
thread.title_full: Clyde duo fall in first round at state tennis meet

title: Clyde duo fall in first round at state tennis meet
text:
Clyde duo fall in first round at state tennis meet Staff report 5:34 p.m. EDT October 18, 2015 The Clyde doubles team of Emi Bowers, left, and Andrea Nearhood, represented the Fliers in the Division II state tennis tournament, losing in the opening round. (Photo: Josh Morgret / Correspondent) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Clyde’s state tennis tournament-qualifying doubles tennis team found out just how tough the competition can be at the highest level. 
Clyde seniors Emi Bowers and Andrea Nearhood lost their opening round match over the weekend, 6-1, 6-0, falling to Shaker Heights Hathaway Brown’s duo of Catherine Areklett and Ally Persky. 
Bowers and Nearhood, who qualified for the state tournament after falling one match short of doing so last year as juniors, close their season with a record of 20-5. 
Areklett and Persky, who were state runners-up last year, advanced to the championship again, before falling in three sets. Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1LEfouP TOP VIDEOS
